cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi S of Mobile Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: very slowly northward, then turning northeast across southeast Alabama, central Georgia and into South Carolina, eventually exiting into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the AL/FL border (between Mobile Bay AL and Pensacola FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to the north-central Gulf Coast (east of Bay St. Louis MS to Indian Pass FL)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the Florida Panhandle (Bay St. Louis MS to Navarre FL)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast then inland across AL, GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈11%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25–35 kt Friday as the weakening system passes inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor coastal water rise (1–2 ft) possible with persistent on-shore flow; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible Friday, with isolated higher totals producing urban and flash flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Friday; river flooding could follow heavy rain, and residual swells/rip currents likely along the South Carolina coast.
